page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Our block is mainly a farming area with scattered settlement of farm houses and cottages. The Medina valley lies in the centre of the area, so the ground rises to east and west (Maximum 145 metres on Berry hill). Land in the west is mainly arable, growing cereal crops, changing to grassland towards the east. In the north are the two largest areas of settlement, the villages of Chillerton and Rookley, both showing signs of rapid growth. Roughly half the population work and shop in Newport. A{"HELP THE AGED"}bus to Newport give the elderly a change from shopping in the local Spar store. We found the people very kind and friendly.
